com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j

Class JsonRpcMultiServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.JsonRpcBasicServer
      • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.JsonRpcServer
        • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.JsonRpcMultiServer

  • public class JsonRpcMultiServer
extends JsonRpcServer
    A multiple service dispatcher that supports JSON-RPC "method" names that use dot-notation to select a server endpoint. For example: 
     {
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "method": "service.method",
    "params": {"foo", "bar"},
    "id": 1
 }
    An example of using this class is: JsonRpcMultiServer rpcServer = new JsonRpcMultiServer(); rpcServer.addService("Foo", new FooService()) .addService("Bar", new BarService()); A client can then call a test(String, String) method on the Foo service like this: 
     {
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "method": "Foo.test",
    "params": ["some", "thing"],
    "id": 1
 }

      • getServiceName

        protected java.lang.String getServiceName(java.lang.String methodName)
        Get the service name from the methodNode. JSON-RPC methods with the form Service.method will result in "Service" being returned in this case.
        Overrides:
        getServiceName in class JsonRpcBasicServer
        Parameters:
        methodName - method name
        Returns:
        the name of the service, or null

        Parameters:
